stream_context.summary: Kaze UV-maps and textures Course 13’s ice-castle while testing Sauron’s new FBDX3 microcode; performance climbs toward 60 FPS but an RSP bottleneck, lighting bug, and collision-triangle limits still need solutions. Design tasks include an outside area, red-coin route, and refining per-area culling. A Course 1 demo and several optimisation videos are also planned.

development_findings.summary: Integrated FBDX3 microcode; Course 13 now reaches ~50 FPS and may hit 60 FPS on real hardware.
development_findings.quote: I’m pretty sure we can get this to stable 60 now.

development_findings.summary: After memory traffic tuning, the game is now RSP-bound rather than RDP-bound; future optimisation work will target RSP performance.
development_findings.quote: At this point it absolutely is the RSP being the bottleneck.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 platforming layout is essentially finished; current focus is UV mapping and texture pass for individual rooms.
Level currently exceeds collision-triangle memory; temporary fix is to mark some geometry untouchable until a trimmed collision map is built.
development_findings.quote: We are running out of memory for collision triangles… for now, we’re just gonna have to make stuff untouchable.

development_findings.summary: Ambient light disappears near extra light sources under X2 microcode in emulator; works in X3 on hardware. Root cause unknown.
development_findings.quote: When I get close to an additional light source, the ambient light just disappears. I couldn’t figure it out at all.

development_findings.summary: Per-area draw-distance and culling system exists but still renders distant objects like bunnies and birds, hurting FPS.
Outside area for Course 13 is being built; it will host eight red coins and a secret pipe to an 8-bit section, providing two stars.
development_findings.quote: Two stars are going to be related to the outside area… there’s going to be a hidden entrance for the 8-Bit from the outside area.

development_findings.summary: Next public demo will feature only Course 1 so players can test the new camera and Mario controls.
development_findings.quote: The next demo will just be Course 1 so everyone can play with the new camera and the new Mario controls.

development_findings.summary: Planned video schedule: optimisation deep-dive, Course 1 demo, Banjo-Kazooie tech demo, and findings about RSP vs memory bottlenecks.
Design philosophy prioritises emotional tone (cold, mysterious) over pure visual polish; colour choices serve that goal.
development_findings.quote: I want this to feel cold and mysterious, so blue is good.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values evoking player emotion over graphic fidelity in his visual decisions.
With a new child, Kaze intends to increase YouTube output and may “sell out” slightly to support his family financially.
context_findings.quote: Now that I have a child, I need to make more money, so that means a lot more YouTube content.

context_findings.summary: Kaze has no traditional job; all income is from online work, streams, commissions and videos.
context_findings.quote: I don’t have an IRL job. All my jobs are online.

context_findings.summary: He relies on Biobak to refine visuals, seeing his own texture work as a ‘suggestion’ stage.
context_findings.quote: Whatever I do is just kind of like a suggestion for Biobak and he’s gonna make it look a lot better.

context_findings.summary: Shows excitement at performance gains and mild frustration with chat interface and bugs, illustrating typical dev-stream emotions.

biobak.summary: Responsible for final texture polish and overall visual quality; will overhaul Kaze’s placeholder UV/texture work later.

zeina.summary: Currently modelling assets for Course 13’s outside area; Kaze depends on her work for two star objectives.
zeina.quote: We are planning on the outside area and Zeina is making it right now.

zeina.summary: Handles personal tasks such as cutting Kaze’s hair, indicating relaxed spousal collaboration.
zeina.quote: I’m not paying for a haircut. I’m making Zeina do it.

key_stories.title: Unlocking 60 FPS with FBDX3
key_stories.summary: Course 13’s frame-rate was stuck around 30 FPS until Kaze ported Sauron’s FBDX3 microcode and began disabling unnecessarily distant actors.
key_stories.challenge: Previous microcode (X2) and draw distance caused heavy lag.
key_stories.process: Implemented FBDX3, benchmarked on hardware, tested culling of grasshoppers and Goombas.
key_stories.outcome: Frame-rate rose to ~50 FPS; believes stable 60 FPS is achievable, though RSP now limits performance.
key_stories.key_quote: I finished this off-stream… we got FBDX3 working correctly. It’s basically like 50 FPS now.

key_stories.title: Too Many Triangles
key_stories.summary: While building Course 13, the team hit N64 memory limits for collision geometry.
key_stories.challenge: Engine ran out of memory allocated for collision triangles.
key_stories.process: Identified overuse, made certain surfaces non-collidable as a stop-gap.
key_stories.outcome: Level is playable again; final collision map optimisation still pending.
key_stories.key_quote: We are running out of memory for collision triangles… for now, we’re just gonna have to make stuff untouchable.

key_stories.title: Expanding the Castle Grounds
key_stories.summary: An exterior zone is being added to Course 13 to diversify gameplay and FPS load.
key_stories.challenge: Existing level lacked an outdoor section and red-coin objective.
key_stories.process: Zeina models assets; design calls for a small area housing 8 red coins and a hidden retro pipe.
key_stories.outcome: Two stars now planned around the new area, integrating exploration and nostalgia.
key_stories.key_quote: The outside area is small enough to be a separate 8 Red Coins area, and there’s going to be a hidden entrance for the 8-Bit.
